page.title: 09Timbersbrook
page.content: Timbersbrook is a small village of stone-built farms,terraced cottages, larger family houses and modern dwellings.There was a mill called Siver Springs which was for bleaching and dyeing in the cotton industry.It has been demolished and the site is now a picnic area.There is a general stores containing a post office.The old chapel has just been sold to be converted to a house.The terraced cottages were built for factory workers but are now privately owned. Pool Bank Mill is still used by a Heating Firm.The pool above the mill has been filled in and is now used for parking lorries.Above the village the Edge is covered with woodland.Gosberry hole Lane is a rough track leading up to a house.Here there is bracken and bilberry,Silver Birch,Oak and Sycamore It is a home for much wildlife.
